intro: Teline candicans var. umbellata, commonly known as the Umbellate Teline, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its daisy-like inflorescence composed of yellow ray florets and dark褐色 disk florets. The plant typically grows in grassland habitats and thrives in full sun to partial shade. It has narrow, linear leaves and produces small, fluffy seeds that are dispersed by the wind. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens, though it is more commonly found in the wild.
